intro: Stenodraba imbricatifolia, commonly known as the imbricate leaf sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, adapting to harsh, dry environments. Its leaves are arranged in a tight, imbricate pattern, providing structural support and reducing water loss. The flowers, which are usually pink or white, bloom in late spring and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
